content: Hi, I am Akash! Currently, I am a Masters Thesis student at the Astronomisches Rechen-Institut (ARI), ZAH, Univeristy of Heidelberg, Germany. I am working on my thesis with Prof. Andreas Just on the Milky Way's dynamics. My Masters coursework in Heidelberg:   Core courses: Astronomical Techniques, Cosmology, General Relativity, Theoretical Astrophysics   Specialisation: Stellar Astrophysics, Galactic and Extragalactic Astronomy, Dynamics of Galaxies, Star Clusters and Planetary Systems (Advance Seminar)    Select Electives:  The Stellar Cookbook: A practical guideto the theory of stars, Introduction to GPU Accelerated Computing, Computational Statistics and Data Analysis, Statistical Methods, Startup Lab 2020, Solving problems on Quantum hardware    I am interested in observational and simulation based study of nearby stars and galaxy evolution and dynamics including the study of the Milky Way galaxy.

content: This was a self guided project. The aim was to understand the basics of deep learning techniques by using TensorFlow. Here a simple neural network is implemented to find whether a galaxy is spiral or elliptical based on photometric data or images obtained from SDSS. The data was provided by Ashish Mahabal during the 7BISS (2020) summer school.
summary: Setting up a simple neural network to classify the morphology of a galaxy.
title: Deep Learning in Astronomy

content: We a team of two, demonstrated the working of the BB84 and E91 QKD protocol on a IBM quantum computer. We also looked into the transmission of the qubits with and without repeaters to illustrate the working of a quantum network on the IBMQ computer.
summary: Demonstrating two QKD protocols- BB84 and E91 on the IBMQ quantum computer.
title: Quantum Key Distribution- BB84 & E91 Protocol

content: The study of thermonuclear (Type-I) X-ray burst from 4U 1702-429, a low mass X-ray binary (LMXB), using ASTROSATâ€™s Large Area X-ray Proportional Counter (LAPXC) data. This explores the timing and spectral aspects of the data.
summary: Studying the X-Ray emission from the Low Mass X-Ray Binary (LMXB) system 4U-1702-429 using LAXPC.
title: Spectral and timing study of LMXB system 4U 1702-429 using Astrosats X-Ray data

content: This presentation explores the basics of polarimetry using Jones and Stokes formalism and material interaction of polarised light.
summary: A literature survey and a presentation on the basics of polarimetry, covering the topics of Jones and Stokes formalism and material interactions with a hands-on laboratory component.
title: Introduction to Polarimetry

content: We, a group of two, synthesized Bismuth Oxyiodide (BiOI) nanodiscs using co-precipitative (CPT) method and intern used X-ray diffraction (XRD) and Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) to confirm its formation. We also tried to experiment with its photocatalytic properties.
summary: Synthesizing Bismuth Oxyiodide (BiOI) nanodiscs and exploring its photocatalytic applications.
title: CPT synthesis of layered BiOI nanodiscs and its photocatalytic applications

content: This Bachelors project discusses the procedures to find best estimates of counts per second in the filters of UVIT, an Ultraviolet Imaging Telescope onboard the Indian space obsorvatory ASTROSAT. This is done for the calibration source HZ4 (a white dwarf) and an open cluster NGC188 at high declination. It also verifies that the process of Flat field correction (inclusive of Remainder Correction) leads to improved photometry.
summary: Bachelors project on the theme of Photometric Calibration of UVIT, an UV Imaging Telescope onboard AstroSat.
title: Photometric Calibration of UVIT
